direction.raw_text: Ohh, OK, caauuse iii... Grandma has fallen asleep, but mumbles like she is continuing the conversation. Hesher smiles to himself, turns off her lamp and exits the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hesher enters. He stands over what's left of the mess on the kitchen floor. He lights up a cigarette off the stove's flame and takes a long, slow drag, as he crouches down and starts picking up pieces of broken plate from the pile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad is asleep on the couch. A single shaft of bright sunlight lands on his face, causing him to stir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nimbly reaches down to the table, covered with dirty dishes and pill bottles, and quietly picks up his dad's wallet. He removes an ATM card and places the wallet back where it was. He exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close on an ATM card, sliding into the slot. Fingers type numbers. A small stack of twenty dollar bills pours out. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: puts the money in a dirty envelope, pockets it and rides off on his bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks through the showroom to Larry's office. Larry is on the phone. TJ stands and waits. Larry watches him. The kid isn't going anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, why don't you just have him send them over... Sure... Scott, can you hold on a minute? (TO TJ) What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I talk to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on the phone here. Can you see that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to talk to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on the phone. Wait outside. I'll be with you in a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes a seat outside the office. Larry closes the door. Dustin Howard appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fuck are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came to talk to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's none of your business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you wanna talk to him about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ignores him. Dustin taps TJ's leg with his foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want to talk about? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just leave me alone. Larry's door opens. Larry emerges from his office. TJ stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The money for the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What money for the car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said if I got eighteen hundred dollars I could have the car back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding me? (BEAT) I said, 'even if you had eighteen hundred dollars, I still couldn't sell it to you.' Even if you had five million dollars, I couldn't sell it to you. It's not even here any more anyway, so that's it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flinches. He wasn't expecting this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? What do you mean-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kid. Leave me alone. I feel like I've had this conversation with you too many times already, but I can tell you we won't be having it again because the car's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all over. It's gone. It's not here. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's it gone?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kid. It's over. Good bye. Larry steps back into his office and shuts the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's it gone? Dustin smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what makes you think I'm gonna tell you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares, angry. An awkward moment passes. He storms away, dragging a water cooler down as he leaves. It crashes onto the ground. Water spills everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: angrily winds his way toward the back of the lot. He stops at the spot where his mom's car once was - now just an empty space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hesher is pouring himself a bowl of Captain Crunch Berries. He pours milk onto the cereal. He does a half-hearted side-to-side stretch, getting ready for his walk. He looks out the window - gray clouds suggest rain. He takes the bowl with him out of the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hesher walks the hall, eating his bowl of Crunch Berries. He stops at Grandma's door and looks in. He stops eating and stands strangely still for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside, we see Grandma's feet sticking out from behind the bed where she lies face down on the ground. Hesher enters the room, cautiously. He stands at the end of the bed. He sets his cereal bowl down, bends and shakes her. No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandma? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shakes her again, this time a little harder. Nothing. He stands up, looking at her still body. As he realizes she is not waking up, his breath becomes fast, fighting hard not to get emotional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gray clouds fill the sky. We hear distant thunder. On his bike,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: coasts down the hill of a tree-lined street. He's upset and trying hard to hold it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drops his bike and enters the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad sits on the couch, his head in his hands. He looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Teej. Hesher enters the room...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He punches a hold in the wall. He paces angrily back & forth. Dad, holding back tears, gets up off the coach and hugs TJ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Teej. Grandma, she's not.. she's not waking up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She won't wake up. Short fast heavy breathing sets in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: runs over to Grandma's room and stops at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Jesus. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He disappears into the room for a second then emerges again in tears, his hands on his face. He heads back to the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, she just, she just didn't wake up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is in shock. He sits on the couch next to dad. They are both lost for words. Hesher stands in the corner with his head shoved between the walls. Hesher joins TJ and Dad on the couch. They are all raging inside, confused, lost and upset. They sit together in silence for a long beat, in the same boat for the first time. Hesher breaks the silence. He kicks the table over as he stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta get the fuck out of here before I hurt someone. He leaves through the front door, leaving it open behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gets up in a daze and stands at the doorway looking out. It has started to drizzle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands in the doorway working up the nerve to enter. He enters and leans down to Grandma and tries to lift her onto the bed. She is heavy for him, he struggles. He gets her on top of the bed and looks at her for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: breaks into tears. He leans down onto the bed holding Grandma, crying into her chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits on his bed and looks inside the envelope of cash. He closes it and seals it shut. On the front he writes: 'NICOLE'S PARKING TICKET FUND. LOVE TJ.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close on a small piece of paper with a hand written number. The numbers are dialed on a phone. TJ waits while the phone rings. Answering machine. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, it's Nicole. I'm not in right now, but leave a message and I'll call you back. Beep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, hi. It's TJ here. I, ah, I'm sorry to bug you, but um, I don't know, I guess I wanted to talk to you right now. I don't know. I have a present for you too, so maybe I'll just come drop it off or something, or ah, yeah... Um, OK. Bye. He hangs up the phone and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks out the front door. Dad is quietly sitting on the front steps wearing a T-shirt in the light rain. TJ goes to his bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Getting some fresh air, I guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's starting to rain. Dad reaches out his hand and catches a few drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: picks up his bike and rides. We stay with Dad as TJ disappears down the wet street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rides his bike. He rounds a corner onto Nicole's street. He jumps off his bike outside her building and wheels it inside the front fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: climbs the stairs of Nicole's building. As he approaches her apartment door, he hears loud, but muffled music. He knocks on the door. No answer. The music is really loud. He knocks again. No answer. He tries the door handle. It gives. He pushes the door open tentatively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: enters the apartment. The music is blasting. He looks around the living area. Clothes are strewn around. He sees Hesher's combat boots, T-shirt, jeans. TJ looks seriously troubled. We can faintly hear heavy breathing/moaning coming from the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks over to a door. It's an inch ajar. He pushes it open gently. We don't see what he sees, but TJ stands deathly still, eyes wide, white as a ghost. We hear Nicole giggle. Then -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Oh shit. TJ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: storms away, heading for the front door. He pulls a lamp smashing to the ground on his way out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: charges down the stairs. He grabs his bike and heads out into the street. Light rain falls. We see Hesher appear behind him, barefoot and topless, buttoning his jeans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: notices Hesher's van parked out the front, he drops his bike and grabs a rusty pipe from a pile of garbage on the sidewalk and heads straight toward the van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, hey... wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes a hard swing into the van, smashing the tail light. Nicole runs out into the street, concerned, wearing an oversized sweatshirt and underpants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! The fuck are you doing? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ignores him and takes another swing at the van. Hesher approaches TJ. TJ takes a swing at him with the pipe. Hesher steps back. Nicole gasps, her hand to her mouth. She doesn't know what to say or do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you. Fuck you fuck you fuck you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop hitting my van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you. (TO NICOLE) And you're a fucking whore. I hope you die. And when you do, no one's gonna fuckin' notice. (BREATHES) Cuz you're a fat fucking prostitute. Hesher steps toward TJ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dude, chill out for a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: swings the pipe at Hesher again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the fuck away from me! I'll smash you in the face, I swear to God. Back the fuck up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: swings again. He's so angry, he's practically foaming at the mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never want to see you or your ugly fucking face again. That goes for both of you fucking assholes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: throws the pipe at Hesher. It hits the road with a loud clang. TJ grabs his bike and rides away furiously. Hesher and Nicole watch TJ ride away. It begins to rain hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glides his bike down a long hill in the pouring rain, in tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rides up the front porch. A funeral home truck is parked out the front - HAPPY EVER AFTER is written on the side. TJ drops his bike and enters the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad sits at the dining room table with a FUNERAL DIRECTOR - a tall, lanky man. He talks in a drawn, soft monotone. Dad doesn't appear to be at all in the mood for this conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After the service we have complimentary lemonade in our wake room, but should you wish to upgrade to soda and sandwiches we can arrange that. People typically like to have a light bite after the service. The front door slams. TJ storms past the dining room table. The funeral director pauses and watches him pass. The sound of TJ's bedroom door slamming shakes the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is angrily pacing back and forth. A gentle knock reveals Dad at his door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you OK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: refuses to look at his dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you just leave me alone. Dad doesn't know what to say beyond this. He feels as lost as TJ does. He leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: paces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He enters the garage violently. TJ sweeps Hesher's belongings off the work bench in the garage. He kicks Hesher's sleeping bag and pillow. A weathered bass guitar leans against a little amplifier. TJ kicks the guitar, snapping it in two. Out of breath, he stands in the mess he has created. Something catches his eye. He contemplates this for a beat. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close on: GARDEN SHEARS. TJ pockets them and exits the garage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: heads straight toward the front door of the house. He exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's raining hard. TJ storms out, just as Hesher is making his way up the path, his van parked on the street behind him. Hesher reaches out his arm to slow TJ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna talk to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pushes Hesher's arm out of the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your fucking hands away from me! I told you, I never want to see you again. Hesher, at a loss, watches TJ grab a brick from the muddy garden and throw it through the passenger side window of his van. Hesher charges TJ. He throws him into the muddy garden and kneels over him holding him by the collar of his hooded sweatshirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fuckin' told you, leave my van out of this! Hesher lifts TJ up and slams him back down on the ground, knocking the wind out of him. TJ struggles to get away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let go of me! Fuckin' let go of me. Dad runs out the front door and pulls Hesher off TJ by the back of his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What in God's name - Hesher shakes free from Dad's grip and punches him square in the nose. Dad goes down hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't fuckin' touch m- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without hesitation, TJ jumps on Hesher's back, bear hugging his face. They struggle for a beat, until Hesher manages to throw TJ off. He lands on the wet grass like a ragdoll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you both! Motherfuckers! Hesher stands breathing hard, dripping wet from the rain, fists clenched. He turns back to his van, gets in, slams the door and peels away. TJ picks himself up out of the mud, grabs his bike and rides off in the opposite direction. Dad stands holding his bloody nose. He watches Hesher, he watches TJ. He is left confused and bleeding in the pouring rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's raining cats and dogs. TJ stands outside Dustin's house, soaking wet with his hoodie pulled over his head, the garden shears in his hand. He walks around the side of the house and looks in the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From TJ's POV outside, we see Dustin in the kitchen preparing a sandwich, one eye on the TV. He takes the sandwich to the couch in front of the TV and lies down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks around the back of the house. He tries the handle to the back door. It's locked. TJ sees the dog door. He climbs through the flap, trying to be as quiet as possible. The TV is loud inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: treads softly through the kitchen, soaking wet, shears poised. He walks through to the living area. He steps behind the couch out of Dustin's line of sight. Dustin's bare feet hang off the end of the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ducks down. He opens the shears and carefully brings them down over Dustin's big toe. He squeezes them shut... Dustin squeals. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's my car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's my fucking car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You make me ask one more time, your toe's coming off. I swear to God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gone to the wrecker's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wrecking yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: squeezes a little harder. Dustin squeals a little louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would I be lying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're a fucking asshole. Tell me where it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gone to the wrecker's. I swear to God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: squeezes harder. Dustin squeals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not lying. It went to the wrecking yard on Sunrise near Red Bridge, yesterday afternoon. It's there now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: thinks, holding Dustin's toe in his grip. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear to God, man. It's at the wrecking yard on Sunrise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're lying, I'm gonna cut off every one of your fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: doesn't quite know what to do now. He stares at Dustin who looks genuinely frightened. TJ releases the shears and backs away. And the second he does so, Dustin leaps off the couch, grabs TJ by the throat and slams him down on the living room floor. TJ drops the shears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You finished? Want to tell me something else while you're visiting? Dustin wails into TJ. TJ cowers on the ground. Punches land
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes CRASHING through the front window into the living room, raining glass everywhere. Dustin stops punching, stunned, and looks up to see Hesher, dripping wet, step through the big nasty hole he has just made.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck? Dustin moves to stand. Hesher pounces on him, dragging him along the ground. He grabs the shears and brings them straight up to Dustin's nose. In the same movement, he snaps the shears shut and takes the end of Dustin's nose off. Dustin squeals in pain and scurries backwards, clutching his face, blood leaking between his fingers. TJ stands, stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is wrong with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my god, my nose!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is wrong with you? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just saved you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You cut his nose off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only a bit, it's just a cut. Dustin is crying now, clutching his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes to the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just cut his nose off!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: runs a rag under the tap and takes it to Dustin. Hesher stands, clutching the shears, confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold this against your face. Dustin moans. Hesher is still confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gotta stop the bleeding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my god!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your problem? Dustin holds the rag. TJ stands to face Hesher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you outta my life. I'm serious. I never want to see you again. How many times do I have say it? They look at each other a moment. Hesher looks taken aback. He honestly believed he was doing a good thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leaves, through the front door. Hesher stands over a whimpering Dustin wondering what went wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rides his bike over a rickety red bridge. He pulls his bike up outside the tall wire fence of a big dirty wrecking yard - D&S Auto-Wreckers. It's still raining very hard. TJ is soaking wet. He sits on his bike, looking at mountains of wrecked cars inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hops off his bike and shoves it behind a dumpster. He gets up on the dumpster and climbs the wrecking yard's fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: &S WRECKING YARD - MOMENTS LATER TJ roams the stacks, looking for his mother's car. He looks distraught. All around sit stacks of wrecked cars. A vicious dog on a chain barks and snarls nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stops. He sees his mom's car atop a tall stack of wrecks. He looks at it a moment, contemplating what to do. He moves to the base of the stack and begins to climb. He clambers slowly up the pile in the rain. It's awkward and difficult and more than a little dangerous. Finally he reaches the top. He wrenches open the car door and squeezes behind the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits, catching his breath. The rain clatters on the roof of the car. TJ is up high enough to see the lights of the surrounding neighborhood. He sits and contemplates the last few days and months of his life. He closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MIDDLE CLASS HOME - DAY FLASHBACK A doorbell rings. TJ runs to the door wearing the bottom half a suit. It's the pizza man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. (yells into house) Pizza's here, I need money. Dad, clean shaven, dressed in a suit, comes to the door and pays. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yells into the house)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pizza's here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (YELLING BACK) Alright, let's do it. The woman comes down the stairs with her hair nicely done, wearing a fancy pink dress, it's TJ's MOM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Teej, c'mon sweetheart. We have to go. We're going to be late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the pizza?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll eat it in the car. She begins to do up TJ's tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, will you grab the present? Dad picks up a large box off the side table, it's clearly heavy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy crap, what is this thing? The three emerge from the house. TJ is wearing a suit and carrying the pizza box, Dad's carrying the heavy present, and Mom's carrying a bouquet of flowers and her purse. Dad stands at the door of a little white car. Clearly the box is too big.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, slight problem. Mom open the back of her red volvo which is parked right next to the white car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll take my car. Dad does a heel spins around the white car and heads towards Mom's red volvo, never losing a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad's driving, eating a slice of pizza. TJ is in the backseat, looking out the window, also eating pizza. Mom does her make-up in the visor mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we should keep the new one and give them our old one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a great idea. I'll be sure to let them know that our dirty old microwave is a gift from you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. I'm not even sure they know who I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, they're my friends. Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just don't understand why they get so many presents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A microwave and a bottle of scotch is hardly a lot of presents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And flowers. Mom half-laughs and shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mouth full of pizza) Mom can you turn on the radio?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure honey. How about some oldies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oldies but goodies. Mom turns on the oldies station. Dion And The Belmont's, "A Teenager In Love" plays. Dad sings along. The car hits a bump. Mom smudges her lipstick. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey? She turns to Dad and we can see her lipstick has gone up onto her cheek. She smiles at Dad. They all smile at this, then - From out of nowhere, the car is T-BONED on the passenger's side. The impact is massive. The NOISE is deafening. Smashed glass. The car spins into the oncoming traffic and is hit by a delivery truck. The car flips. More deafening noise...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: &S WRECKING YARD - MORNING TJ wakes in the wrecked car at the wrecking yard. The loud sound of crunching metal continues. TJ is startled and disoriented. He realizes the car is moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A crane is lifting the car with a huge wrecking yard magnet. As it rises off the stack, it dangles at a precarious angle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is thrown through the car to be wedged up against the windshield. He panics. He yells. He squirms his way to the window and waves his arm wildly outside, yelling, trying to get the attention of the guys below. The car shifts violently and TJ slides out through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: &S WRECKING YARD - CONTINUOUS TJ is hanging dangerously out of the car, swinging his legs and screaming at the top of his lungs. His voice can barely be heard over the sound of machinery. A guy on the ground, MARIO, looks up and spots TJ. He frantically looks to get the crane operator's attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ricky! (YELLS LOUDER) Ricky! Kill it, man. Ricky sticks his head out of the crane cab, like he can't hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill it! There's someone in the car! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks to the entrance gate while behind him his mom's car is hoisted high in the air.

direction.raw_text: stops at a dirty vending machine by the gate. He pulls coins from his pocket and slots them in. It spits out a chocolate bar. Moments later TJ stands with his half-eaten chocolate bar while watching his Mom's car get fed into a giant crushing machine and compacted into scrap. Tears well in his eyes. He feels helpless.

direction.raw_text: walks in the front door. Dad jumps up from the couch. He has a bandage on his nose and a black eye. He looks distraught, like he's been up all night.

direction.raw_text: Where have you been? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where have you been?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I lost track of time.

direction.raw_text: You lost track of time? It's ten in the morning!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been up all night. How is that fair to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Dad looks at him, breathing hard. Tears well in his eyes. Dad starts crying, he's falling to bits.

direction.raw_text: Just go to your room. Dad knows he's being pathetic. TJ walks off down the hall.

direction.raw_text: stands in front of a mirror trying to correctly tie his neck tie. He makes a sad attempt and leaves it - it looks wrong. There's a knock at TJ's bedroom door, but the door doesn't open.

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) There's someone at the front door for you.

direction.raw_text: Nicole stands at the door. TJ is unimpressed with seeing her. He stands in the doorway looking silly with his tie.

direction.raw_text: Hesher's not here.

direction.raw_text: I came to see you. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Why? What do you want?

direction.raw_text: I wanted to tell you something.

direction.raw_text: stares at her.

direction.raw_text: I didn't know if I should come here or not, but I couldn't stop thinking about it. I thought maybe if I came you'd still just be really angry at me and hate me, but then I thought if I didn't you'd think I didn't care and you'd hate me anyway, so I figured I might as well come, just in case, so here I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well what do you want?

direction.raw_text: I want to apologize. I feel bad about what happened. I didn't take your feelings into consideration -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes it does. It does to me. I like you, TJ. We're friends.

direction.raw_text: looks at her, he doesn't really want to be mad at her.

direction.raw_text: I understand if you don't want to be my friend. I didn't mean to hurt your feelings. Sometimes I just... I don't know. I just wanted to come around and say all that, but maybe you still hate me and so it doesn't matter, but I just came round to say that, but I've said it now, so I should just go. So,

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME - AFTERNOON Dad and TJ drive into the funeral home parking lot in Grandma's car. A few people are milling around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME - DAY Dad and TJ enter the funeral home foyer. They look like they don't know where they're supposed to go. They are greeted by the funeral director from earlier. He talks in a soft monotone whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, Mr. Forney, may I have a word? He takes Dad aside. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate to have to do this here, but there's a couple of things I need to discuss with you quickly, if that's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, sure.

direction.raw_text: I know that we discussed your preferences for some aspects of today's service, including your choice of the cedar casket which the insurance company had covered. Unfortunately we were out of those and instead we've chosen a mahogany casket. Now there is an extra charge for the mahogany which I need to clear with you before we proceed. Is that
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ? Dad looks confused. He doesn't know how he's supposed to respond.

direction.raw_text: Ah, I guess.

direction.raw_text: great, thank you. If you could just sign here. The director hands Dad a fancy pen and holds out a dense order form for him to sign.

direction.raw_text: Now, just one other thing - we have another service following yours today, we hate to do this, but we're going to have to try to get through yours as quickly as possible. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: I don't want you to feel rushed, but we are really under the pump today and I just thought I should give you the heads up. Now, I notice, just looking at your order of service... direction.raw_text: OK. Excuse me. The funeral director walks away and answers his phone.

direction.raw_text: The funeral director stands at the front of the room. He hits play on the in-house stereo - generic classical musak. TJ and Dad take seats next to each other, but they might as well be a hundred miles apart. About ten other people sit. The funeral director hits stop. He stands and approaches the microphone.

direction.raw_text: We are gathered here today to mourn the loss and commemorate the life of Madeleine Frances Forney. (to arriving late comers) Ah, if you could please take your seats as quickly as possible that'd be great. Thank you. (he waits a beat) Madeleine was a beloved wife, mother, grandmother and friend. And now Mrs Agnes Rosowski, a dear friend and neighbor, will say a few quick words.

direction.raw_text: hobbles her way to the microphone.

direction.raw_text: I did not know Madeleine long enough, but from the moment I moved into the neighborhood so many years ago, she treated me as though I was part of the family. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Madeleine always had open arms and welcomed friends as kindly as her own. She had such a kind wonderful heart. While Agnes speaks, TJ and Dad notice the funeral director, off to the side, whispering business to two of his employees. He makes every attempt to be subtle and discreet about it, but he is clearly struggling with today's workload.

direction.raw_text: We shared so many wonderful walks and enjoyed each other's company very much. I will miss our walks. I will miss our talks and most of all, I will miss Madeleine. I will always remember what she told me, life is like walking in the rain, you can either hide and take shelter or you can just get wet. She was dear to me and she will always have a place in my heart. Agnes places her hand on Grandma's coffin and stands for a long silent beat.

direction.raw_text: I love you, Madeleine. Another drawn out moment of silence. The funeral director takes this opportunity to step to the microphone.

direction.raw_text: thank you, Agnes... Agnes steps towards her seat. When she sees TJ she stops.

direction.raw_text: - and I'm not fuckin' here to say goodbye or have my farewell or whatever the fuck you assholes call it - this is not how I want to say goodbye to someone I like - in this shit-hole with these- Hesher points to the funeral director.

direction.raw_text: - fuckin' assholes. TJ's dad stands and interrupts.

Some shrapnel had penetrated my left scrotal sack and ripped the furry sucker right off. My left fucking nut was gone, just like that. direction.raw_text: All this time I'd been driving myself crazy thinking about my missing nut and not thinking about the nut I still had all along. And I realized, I've still got a nut. I've still got one good nut. God or the Devil or whoever left me with one good nut. At least I didn't lose both my nuts. I've still got one good nut and it works, and my dick works too. Hesher looks up at TJ and Dad, sad and imploring, he's made his point. They look back at him stunned.

direction.raw_text: You lost your mom. You lost your wife. I lost a nut. Hesher takes the last swig of his Budweiser. He sways, drunk. This soaks in with the crowd.

direction.raw_text: Fuck this. Hesher throws the can down. He goes to stomp on it. He misses and stumbles, crashing into the microphone podium, knocking it over and falling in a heap with it. He starts puking on the stage. A couple of old ladies are horrified. The funeral director motions to his assistants that now is the time to move the coffin out. Hesitantly, they obey. Hesher looks over from the floor.

direction.raw_text: Leave her alone. We're not finished yet.

direction.raw_text: I told Grandma I was going on a walk with her and I'm gonna do it! Determined, Hesher leans down and unlocks the wheels of the coffin stand. Dad stands, not exactly sure what to do. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: With purpose Hesher pushes the coffin down the stage ramp and down the center aisle of the room, toward the exit. He turns to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You promised Grandma you'd go on a walk with her. This is your last chance. Hesher seems overcome with emotion, he continues pushing the coffin toward the exit and out through the doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and Dad watch him, unsure. After a moment, They follow him to the door. They stand at the doors watching Hesher push the coffin out into the parking lot.

direction.raw_text: is overcome with emotion, his eyes well with tears. He heads across the lot and catches up with Hesher, joining him on the walk. Dad watches for a beat, his eyes well up too, then he does the same. All three are now walking together through the funeral home parking lot with Grandma's coffin. They don't speak. It's a release. Other mourners watch from the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME - CONTINUOUS Hesher wheels Grandma's coffin across the parking lot with TJ and Dad beside him. They seem solemn and strangely dignified in a dishevelled way. Hesher leads them out of the parking lot and into the street. Traffic passes around them. Some cars come to a complete stop. Hesher gets the coffin up onto the sidewalk on the other side of the street and the three continue their silent walk with Grandma. In slow motion the three walk. Dad puts his arm around TJ's shoulders, TJ puts his arm around Dad's. And then a cop car cruises beside them slow. The cops inside watch them. Dad looks over. One of the cops smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cop car pulls up outside the house. The back door opens and Hesher falls out onto the sidewalk, still very drunk. Dad climbs out and steps over Hesher helping him to his feet. A cop speaks to them from the open window. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll get him to bed now, won't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the plan. Hesher squirms and slurs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your hands off me, pig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the plan. The cop gives them a casual wave as their car pulls away. TJ and Dad help Hesher across the lawn to the front door. We hold on the house for a beat.

direction.raw_text: Close on scissors to beard. Dad stands over the sink cutting away at his beard. Golden sunlight pours in through the windows. A moment later he lathers his face up with shaving cream.

direction.raw_text: There's a gentle knock at the door. TJ wakes and makes a big stretch. His hair's a mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. Dad enters, he's clean-shaven now. He looks like a new man.

direction.raw_text: Morning, Teej.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Look at you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. It feels weird. I can feel air on my face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hardly recognize you. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: I think Hesher's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gone where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. But I think you should come take a look at this.

direction.raw_text: The garage door is open. The garage is flooded with daylight and no sign of Hesher.
